article-meta.issue-title: Special Issue: Climate Change and the Emergence of New Organizational Landscapes

p.bold: Fifth International Symposium on Process Organization Studies
Theme: The Emergence of Novelty in Organizations

body.p: General process-oriented and theme-focused papers are invited

p.bold: Minoa Palace Resort, Chania, Crete, Greece

body.p: Raghu Garud, Penn State University, USA (rug14@smeal.psu.edu)
Barbara Simpson, University of Strathclyde, UK (barbara.simpson@strath.ac.uk)
Haridimos Tsoukas, University of Cyprus, Cyprus & University of Warwick, UK (process.symposium@gmail.com)
Keith Ansell-Pearson, Professor of Philosophy, University of Warwick, UK, author of Germinal Life, editor of A Companion to Nietzsche
Deborah Dougherty, Professor of Management, Rutgers Business School, USA
Jaan Valsiner, Professor of Psychology, Clark University, USA, editor of Culture and Psychology, and co-editor of The Cambridge Handbook of Sociocultural Psychology

Submissions are invited for: (a) the General Track, which includes papers exploring a variety of organizational phenomena from a process perspective, or (b) the Thematic Track, which includes papers addressing the particular theme of the Symposium.

Deadlines: Submit to Haridimos Tsoukas (process.symposium@gmail.com) an extended abstract of about 1000 words by January 31st, 2013. The submission must be made via email, it must be a Word attachment, and it should contain authors’ names, institutional affiliations, email and postal addresses, and indicate the Track for which the submission is made (General or Thematic), while the subject matter line of the email should indicate “Process Symposium”. Authors will be notified of acceptance or otherwise by March 4th, 2013. Full papers will be submitted by May 31st, 2013.
For a full description of the Call for Papers, as well as for past Symposia, please visit www.process-symposium.com
